intro: Globba villosula var. adhaerens, commonly known as the hairy globba, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant features rhizomatous growth and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are typically hairy, giving it the "hairy" descriptor in its scientific name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, spicy aroma.
